msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4171

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left and right hand sides. kollesis at the middle of the column. There are two big lacunae and small ones as a result of three folds. No restoration is needed.

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated the new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer.

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Petsiris, son of Pasion, grandson of Petsiris, mother Taonnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 211)
Pasion the son, mother Thases (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 198)
Phanomgeus, son of Phanomgeus, grandson of Phanomgeus, mother Tapsais (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. )
Horion, son of Petheus, grandson of Esouris, mother Komonis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 249)
Leonides, son of Ptolemaios, grandson of Pnepheros, mother Heras (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 184)
Agathopous, slave of Thermouthis, alias Tpaietis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 148)
Orsenouphis, son of Petheus, grandson of Horion, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 194)
Orsenouphis, son of Heron, grandson of Orsenouphis, mother Zoidous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 193)
Leouas, son of Petheus, grandson of Sokmenis, mother Tapapeis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 184)
Longinus, also called Gemellus bastard, mother Taphois (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 185)
Hermation, slave of Isidoros (Longinus) alias Isidoros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 163)
Anoubas, son of Horos, grandson of Anoubas, mother Tepheros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 151)
Dionysius, bastard, mother Tepheros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 162)
Petaus, son of Sisois, grandson of Satabous, mother Thermouthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 209)
Horion, son of Phasis, grandson of Esouris, mother Tanomgeus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 249)
Paoueites, son of Petheus, grandson of Phasis, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 197)
Pasoknopaios, son of Phasis, grandson of Esouris, mother Tanomgeus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 199)
Kommon, bastard, mother Tasoucharion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 183)
Patron, son of Sokmenis, grandson of Sokmenis, mother Taonnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 200)
Harpagathes, son of Ptolemaios, grandson of Harpagathes, mother Tasiaipis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 155)
Melanas, son of Pnepheros, grandson of Pakysis, mother Tasoucharion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 188)
Ischyras, son of Panesneus, grandson of Ischyras, mother Tamystha (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 179)
Ptolemaios, son of Pasoxis, grandson of Satabous, mother Heras (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 218)
Horos, son of Anchophis, grandson of Herakles, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 249)
Onnophris, son of Pnepheros, grandson of Phanomgeus, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 192)
Ptolemaios, son of Phanomgeus, grandson of Phanomgeus, mother Taptosiris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 219)
Gaios, son of Petronios, grandson of Germanos (wife of Abykis son of Kepis) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 159)
Kastor, son of Kastor, grandson of Apollonios, mother Heraklous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 181)
Sisois, slave of Tasoucharion, granddaughter of Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 229)
Onnophris, son of Onnophris, grandson of Sambas, mother Thermouthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)�ǥ

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
